page.title: 11MOVERONS FARM
page.content: Moverons Farm,lying entirely east of the River Colne,consists of 400 acres of land,part marshy,part glacial gravel,and most of it under cereal crops.Wheat and barley take up 150 acres each,the rest of the farm being under 46 acres of peas,10 acres of potatoes,an experimental 2 acre crop of lupins,grown for their oil,and 42 acres of grass grown for hay. The farm is on an exposed site,affected by strong winds,although the air is less moist than adjacent to the sea at Brightlingsea Point. It is interesting that Dutch Elm disease has destroyed the farm's windshield of elms and that the farmhouse front door has been moved from the north side of the house since the north wind in winter negated the effects of the central heating.
